subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etyl}}
{{Han compound|十|又|ls=ic|t1=ten|t2=hand}} – ten ''chi'' ({{zh-l|*尺}}) is one ''zhang'' ({{lang|zh|丈}}).

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text:
{{zh-pron
|m=zhàng
|m-s=zang4
|c=zoeng6
|h=pfs=chhong/chhông
|md=dâung/diông/tiông
|md_note=dâung - unit of measure; diông/tiông - kinship term
|mn=xm,tp,kh,yl,tc,hc,sx,km,mg:tiūⁿ/zz,tn:tiōⁿ/qz,lk:tiǔⁿ/pn:tiāuⁿ/xm,zz,tw:tn̄g/qz:tňg/xm,tw:tiōng/zz:tiāng/qz:tiǒng
|mn_note=tiūⁿ/tiōⁿ/tiǔⁿ, tn̄g/tňg - vernacular; tiōng/tiāng/tiǒng - literary
|mn-t=deng6/ziang6/diên6/dion6
|mn-t_note=deng6 - unit of measurement; ziang6 - “to measure”; diên6/dion6 - “gentleman”
|w=3zan
|mc=y
|oc=y
|cat=n,v
}}

subSections.title: Definitions
subSections.text:
{{zh-hanzi}}

# A [[unit]] of [[measurement]].
## The ''[[zhang]]'', a [[traditional]] [[Chinese]] [[unit]] of [[length]] [[equal]] to 10 [[chi]] ({{zh-l|*尺}})
## The [[mainland China|mainland]] ''[[zhang]]'', a [[unit]] of [[length]] [[standardize]]d in 1984 as 3 <sup>1</sup>/<sub>3</sub> [[meter]]s.
## The [[Taiwanese]] ''[[zhang]]'', a [[unit]] of [[length]] [[standardize]]d as 3 <sup>1</sup>/<sub>33</sub> [[meter]]s, [[identical]] to the [[Japanese]] [[jō]].
## The [[Hong Kong]] ''jeuhng'', [[standardize]]d as 3.71475 [[meter]]s.
# to [[survey]] (land); to [[measure]]
# [[gentleman]]; [[man]]; [[husband]]
#: {{zh-x|丈夫|husband}}
